result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Zachary C Wood was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

04-30-2015 - The Court orders as an additional condition of Probation Mr. Wood is to pay restitution for medical bills to the victim, Domingo Ramirez in the amount of $3181.85 plus the 10% restitution processing fee.
Additionally the Court notes that if Mr. Wood's insurance pays all or part of the $3181.85 then Mr. Woods is entitled an offset.

The Court orders that Mr. Woods is to pay restitution for the damaged vehicle to American Family in the amount of $4209.47 , this amount is to be entered into Civil Judgement in favor of American Family Insurance.

records.addlTxt: DOC Balance Inquiry
DOC balance inquiry
JOC will not be modified. The SCRAMX monitoring is in lieu of conditional jail time and is served as part of the alcohol treatment court program with the consent of the Sheriff.
from DOC requesting clarification of the probation term ordered for Count #1

[MK] case called at 1:33pm. 
Defendant Zachary C Wood in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Probation Agent Julie Basel is present. 
Ms. Basel indicates that her position that Mr. Wood has made a good faith effort to make payments on the restitution amount that is due.
Mr. Wood provides information on his health circumstances and its affect on his ability to work. Mr. Wood indicates that he has been contacted by his employer about returning to work; he is a heavy equipment operator through a union, so he feels he will be able to pay the balance due on restitution within one year. 
The Court extends the Probation term for one year, but authorizes early discharge upon payment of all financial obligations.  The clerk is directed to amend the Judgement of Conviction.
recess 1:36pm
Probation review hearing on February 14, 2017 at 01:15 pm.
DOC Balance Inquiry

records.addlTxt: The Petition is granted because the Court finds that the person is indigent. Further, the Court limits liability to one-half the cost of equipping each motor vehicle with an ignition interlock device and one-half of the cost per day per vehicle of maintaining the ignition interlock device.

ADDRESS INFO for Zachary C Wood
Current: 6142 Cty Hwy I, Waunakee, WI 53597 United States  (Effective: 03-04-2016)
Prior: 1992 Montana Ave, Sun Prairie, WI 53590
of the Plea and Sentencing Hearing held on March 5, 2015 before the Honorable Randy R Koschnick
FINANCIAL NOTES: per voicemail from Victim Witness Coord/DA's office - Victim info is: American Family Insurance, 6000 American Parkway, Madison, WI 53783. Policy and/or Claim # not provided.

Case called at 3:34pm [mo]
Defendant Zachary C Wood in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The parties stipulate to the restitution amounts.
The Court orders as an additional condition of Probation Mr. Wood is to pay restitution for medical bills to the victim, Domingo Ramirez in the amount of $3181.85 plus the 10% restitution processing fee.
Additionally the Court notes that if Mr. Wood's insurance pays all or part of the $3181.85 then Mr. Woods is entitled an offset.

The Court orders that Mr. Woods is to pay restitution for the damaged vehicle to American Family in the amount of $4209.47 , this amount is to be entered into Civil Judgement in favor of American Family Insurance.
Atty. Svehlek alerts the Court of frustrations occurring regarding Mr. Wood not being able to participate in the Alcohol Treatment Court. This is related to Mr. Wood not being able to pay Huber fees. Atty Svehlek intends to contact the Agent and WCS staff to look into this matter. 
The Court indicates that Mr. Wood should be actively in Treatment Court as soon as possible
recess:3:39pm
Restitution hearing on April 30, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Scheduling notice
Huber/work release notification

Case called at 10:34 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Zachary C Wood in court, in-custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 & #3
ADA Shock submits victim impact statement; Counsel agree that a re-sentencing will be needed if Mr. Wood is in fact not accepted into Alcohol Treatment Court - Court also notes that It would consider allowing Mr. Wood to withdraw his plea

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Wood to 4 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years. This sentence is  IMPOSED & STAYED and the Court places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years with conditions: 
--serve 120 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence forthwith to be followed immediately by 120 days on SCRAM X ("good time" credit to be applied to both components of order)
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--To comply with all conditions of the Jefferson County Alcohol Treatment Court
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid DL and Agent approval
--To pay a fine of $2400 + costs
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To pay $59.06 blood testing costs (FAPD)
--To undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling required by Agent
--To pay restitution to Domingo Ramirez as determined by Restitution Hearing and/or Stipulation

If revoked, The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 0 days credit for time already served.

Conditions Not of Probation:
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--County alcohol/drug assessment ordered
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device requirement/restrictions for: 36 months
--6 demerit points assessed

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Recess: 11:01 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Restitution Hearing 4/30/15 at 3:30 pm - Send notices **Will be canceled if stipulation is received**
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 5, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Case called at 1:15 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Zachary C Wood appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that Mr. Wood is eligible for SPD Representation

Service of Complaint admitted; DOB & address confirmed accurate; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $7500 CASH bond, with conditions:
-Defendant to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  Defendant to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse.  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
-Not drive a motor vehicle
